column4: so there's GOT to be a better way to automount usb drives than messing with /etc/rc.d/rc.autofs
I just want the drive mounted to the same mountpoint every time.  That's it.
and what the HELL is a UUID?  why the hell do I need to know a 40 bit random string?
yeah, time to install an OS that doesn't require me to jump through these kinds of hoops
wtf?  why isn't autofs using blkid to do this shit for me?
logging out will not free up the mountpoint
kill the thing it's telling you is using that file system
i cant kill that process, i need it to keep running
So, you won't kill the process that is preventing you from unmounting the drive?
other important process are using it
those processes are hosed anyway if you manage to unmount that filesystem
what do you mean lsof doesn't work?
